job title: Federal Work Study III-Data Analyst Assistant (Ohio History Connection)
job description:
Requisition ID: req2130
Job Title: Federal Work Study III-Data Analyst Assistant (Ohio History Connection)

Department: Career Services

Location: Columbus Campus

Employment Type: Student Employment

Employment Status: Student Employment

Bargaining Unit: Non-Bargaining Unit

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Compensation Type: Hourly

Compensation Range: $10.20 (effective August 16, 2018)

Schedule: Hours available between Monday-Friday, 9 a.m.-4 p.m. (approximately 10-20 hours a week) with possible weekends. Maximum 20 hours per week.

End Date(if applicable): 8/10/2019

Job Description:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential duty listed below. Reasonable accommodations will be made for persons with disabilities, covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, in accordance with its requirements.

Description: The Data Analyst Assistant will help analyze qualitative and quantitative data gathered on current visitors and past visitors. The data comes in the form of highly focused visitor observations, interviews and questionnaires. This position will use data to uncover information related to who is visiting, why they are visiting, and what the people who are already engaging with us think.

Organization/Agency Overview: The mission of Ohio History Connection is to spark discovery of Ohio's stories and embrace the present, share the past and transform the future.

Location: 800 E. 17th Ave., Columbus Ohio, 43211

Website: https://www.ohiohistory.org

Duties are numbered for convenience, and do not indicate order in terms of importance, frequency that the duty is performed, or the amount of time spent on the duty.
  • Enters visitor interview and observation data into a database
  • Performs data analysis
  • Prepares preliminary reports and visualizations
  • Occasionally builds questionnaires, compiles or enters data using Microsoft Excel or basic survey interfaces, such as Survey Monkey
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of: Basic understanding of descriptive statistics, correlations and regressions, and differences.

Skill in: qualitative and quantitative data analysis using Microsoft Excel; oral and written communication; time management; attention to detail.

Ability to: record information accurately; be a self-starter and self-directed.

Minimum Qualifications:
This position requires applicants to have Federal Work Study as part of their current Financial Aid package with Columbus State. You must also be enrolled in SIX or more credit hours in a degree or certificate program. Click here for a full explanation of eligibility requirements or visit Nestor Hall 113 to request Federal Work Study if you were not awarded it already. Any applicants without Federal Work Study eligibility will not be considered for this position.

Applicants must be at least 18 years of age or have received a high school diploma or a certificate of attendance from an accredited secondary school or a certificate of high school equivalence and be exempt from Ohio Revised Code Chapter 4109.

Must have reliable transportation or other means to get to work regularly.

Students enrolled as Transient, College Credit Plus, Undecided, or otherwise non degree-seeking are not considered eligible for Student Employment.

Preferred Qualifications:
Students from all backgrounds and experience are welcome, especially those who have an interest in working in research and evaluation, museum studies, history, sociology, psychology, marketing, education, and those who want to gain applied social science research skills.
Seeking students from the following Career & Academic Pathways or Majors:
  • Marketing Major
  • Psychology Major
  • Sociology Major

    Additional Information: This position is a part of the Community Work Study program and is NOT located on-campus at Columbus State. The Hiring Supervisor will directly contact you should they be interested in interviewing.
